TopicTitle: error message, says send to developer

Articles.Content:
have been playing KSP fine for months then today error on loading message telling me what folder the error log file is at opened it with notepad, load of stuff i dont understand. how do i get it to the dev team..

 

regards Brian

You could send an email to the developers mabye? theres email adress(es?) on the official ksp website: kerbalspaceprogram.com or something.

 

But this same sort of thing is happening to me too. I cant load my game.  Im pretty sure its the new "away with words" or whatever the newest update is. (it happened the first time after the update, not before). Havent played since (these 2 days or so) Im dying inside . \_(;-;)_/, im just blaming it on the update. Its the most logical problem. Just a glitch in the update.

I'm getting the same thing after the latest update. Sent the log and now getting crickets chirping. Obviously, I'm not the only one having this issue. So, they need to post something in the forum telling us they're working on the fix. In this instance, silence is NOT golden.

Here are the instructions for reporting bugs:

I'm assuming you are using steam. I would recommend:
a) Going into Steam Properties for KSP and verifying your files. To do this: right click KSP in the steam client application and select "Properties". Then Select the "LOCAL FILES" tab and then click "VERIFY INTEGRITY OF GAME FILES...."
b) Ensure you don't have any mods installed in your steam directory for KSP. Or if you do, ensure those mods are updated for KSP 1.3.

I did that, they said the integrity of the files were 100% every time. I also figured out that if ur on steam, to play the game, go to "betas" in "properties" of kerbal space program and go to one of the lowest (i did the lowest one and it worked). So for now, in order to play the game (for me anyways), u need to play the old school updates. lol xD. Rip us all.
